parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To wake out of sleep, arouse in general, stir up. From dia and egeiro; to wake fully; i.e. Arouse.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From epi and timao; to tax upon, i.e. Censure or admonish; by implication, forbid.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The wind; fig: applied to empty doctrines. From the base of aer; wind; by implication, quarters.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Probably prolonged from hals; the sea.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To keep silence, be silent, either voluntarily or involuntarily. From siope; to be dumb; figuratively, to be calm.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Perfect Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Singular
str2: To muzzle, silence. From phimos; to muzzle.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
The wind; fig: applied to empty doctrines. From the base of aer; wind; by implication, quarters.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To abate, cease raging, be stilled. From kopos; to tire, i.e. to relax.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: A prolongation and middle voice form of a primary verb; to cause to be, i.e. to become, used with great latitude.
Large, great, in the widest sense.
A calm. Of uncertain derivation; tranquillity.
